Sentencas: In this study, cathode performance of cost-effective inert substrate-supported solid oxide fuel cells fabricated by a single step cosintering process is investigated.
Titulo: Impact of silicate substrate and cosintering on cathode performance in an inert substrate-supported solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The polarization resistance of cosintered inert substrate-supported cathode symmetrical cells (ISC) is compared with the polarization resistance of electrolyte-supported symmetrical cells (ESC) prepared by post- and cosintering.
Titulo: Impact of silicate substrate and cosintering on cathode performance in an inert substrate-supported solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: ESC prepared by cosintering have similar polarization resistance than ESC prepared by post-firing due to the addition of pore formers.
Titulo: Impact of silicate substrate and cosintering on cathode performance in an inert substrate-supported solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: However, the implementation of a porous inert substrate increases the polarization resistance.
Titulo: Impact of silicate substrate and cosintering on cathode performance in an inert substrate-supported solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Analysis of electrochemical impedance spectra could exclude a gas-phase diffusion limitation due to the porous substrate.
Titulo: Impact of silicate substrate and cosintering on cathode performance in an inert substrate-supported solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Time-of-Flight secondary ion mass spectrometry (ToF-SIMS) reveals an accumulation of zinc, magnesium and silicon on the inner pore surface of the cathode layer.
Titulo: Impact of silicate substrate and cosintering on cathode performance in an inert substrate-supported solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Thermodynamic calculations confirm desorption of these elements from the silicate substrate during the cosintering.
Titulo: Impact of silicate substrate and cosintering on cathode performance in an inert substrate-supported solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: In addition, a zinc manganite spinel is detected in the cathode layer via confocal Raman spectroscopy, which indicates a reaction between the cathode material and zinc.
Titulo: Impact of silicate substrate and cosintering on cathode performance in an inert substrate-supported solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The larger cathode polarization resistance of the inert substrate-supported cell is attributed to microstructural changes and the coverage of the cathode surface.
Titulo: Impact of silicate substrate and cosintering on cathode performance in an inert substrate-supported solid oxide fuel cell
